content:
• Monday, December 4, 2017
  • CLF

    Cleveland-Cliffs -7% on news of two note offerings

    • Cleveland-Cliffs (NYSE:CLF) -7.2% after-hours as it announces two offerings, one of $400M of senior secured notes due 2024 and another of $275M of convertible senior notes due 2025.
    • CLF says it plans to use the proceeds from the two offerings to finance a substantial portion of its hot briquetted iron capital project and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM | 51 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook targets young children with Messenger Kids

    • Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) introduced a version of its Messenger app for young children -- a move that some investors see as a great branding move against younger-skewing competitors like Snap (NYSE:SNAP), but which is raising some consumer privacy issues.
    • Messenger Kids, now out in preview, is targeted at the under-13 set that isn't permitted to sign up for Facebook's standard apps or its Instagram service.
    • It's a stand-alone app that Facebook says can be controlled via a parent's Facebook account (it won't create an account for the children) and which is the product of engagement with "over a dozen expert advisors in the areas of child development, online safety and children’s media and technology who’ve helped inform our approach to building our first app for kids."
    • Meanwhile, online child safety advocate Common Sense Media says “We urge Facebook to make its policies loud and clear – will the product remain ad-free? What data are they collecting and exactly how are they using it? Will parents get ads based on the service? Will they ever erase the group chats that kids are having?"
    • Shares in Snap lagged Facebook in performance for much of the morning, though both stocks ended up similarly in the red: FB -2.1%; SNAP -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM | 33 Comments
  • REED

    Reed’s announces new partnerships, to evaluate assets

    • Reed's (NYSEMKT:REED) +5.4% after-hours on news the soft-drink seller has secured multi-year contracts with Owens-Illinois (NYSE:OI) as its exclusive glass supplier and R.C. Moore as its primary logistics partner for North America as it moves to an asset-light business model.
    • Reed's also says it has hired Gordon Brothers to lead the company's process of evaluating and maximizing the value of its operational and non-core assets.
    • Reed's expects improvements from lower glass and logistics costs to begin in early 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: ALPN +4.7%. DEPO +4.1%. NAT +2.8%. IMMU +2.2%. XENE +2.1%.
    • Top losers: ASNA -20.7%. CLF -5.9%. CYH -3.6%. COUP -3.3%. CYD -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 7 Comments
  • TIVO

    TiVo -6.8%; B. Riley sees uncertainty around Comcast patent ruling

    • TiVo (TIVO -6.8%) declined steadily into today's close with one of its worst days in months following new skepticism from B. Riley tied to uncertainty around the company's International Trade Commission victory over Comcast (CMCSA +4.9%).
    • The ITC ruled that Comcast violated two TiVo patents with the guides on its set-top boxes, and issued an exclusion order banning import and sales of the X1 boxes
    • But the ITC isn't able to impose a direct financial penalty, analyst Eric Wold notes, and timing of a trial at U.S. District Court could be pushed out another 6-12 months from the middle of next year during a review by the Patent Trial and Appeal Board. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Wold cut his price target to $24 from $31 -- that's now 45% upside from today's close -- but maintains a Buy rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • GDDY

    GoDaddy announces public offering

    • GoDaddy (NYSE:GDDY) announces a public offering to sell 7,277,622 shares of Class A common stock.
    • Selling stockholders are entities affiliated with Technology Crossover Ventures and a GoDaddy exec. 
    • GoDaddy won’t receive any proceeds from the selling stockholders but will benefit from the separate sale of 50K shares. The company will use those proceeds to pay transaction expenses for the offering and general corporate purposes. 
    • GoDaddy shares are down 0.68% aftermarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • INOD

    Innodata announces special committee to investigate board, operations

    • Innodata (NASDAQ:INOD) announces the board is establishing a special committee to determine whether to reduce or sell some of the company’s operations.
    • Innodata announced $2M in cost cuts last quarter and now hopes to cut at least $1M more.   
    • The committee will also review the board’s current composition to decide if the members align with the needs of the business. 
    • Innodata shares closed today down 4.3%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • COLL

    Collegium nabs U.S. rights to Depomed's Nucynta

    • Collegium Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:COLL) inks an agreement with Depomed (DEPO) under which it will have the rights to commercialize pain med Nucynta (tapentadol) Immediate Release and Nucynta ER Extended Release tablets in the U.S.
    • Collegium expects to commercialize Nucynta via its existing retail and hospital sales forces. The deal will be immediately accretive and will significantly boost revenue.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Depomed will receive $10M upfront, a cash payment for its existing inventory (shelf life at least 12 months); at least $135M per year for four years and double-digit royalties on sales greater than $233M per year. After year 4, Collegium will pay double-digit royalties on all net sales. After 12 months, Collegium can cancel the agreement with 12 months notice and the payment of a $25M termination fee.
    • The transaction should close next month.
    • In Q3, Nucynta accounted for almost 62% of DEPO's product sales ($58.7M/95.2M).
    • Collegium will host a conference call tomorrow, December 6, at 8:30 am ET to discuss the deal.
    • COLL and DEPO are up 1% and 2%, respectively, after hours, both on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs rally on tax hopes?

    • The iShares FTSE Nareit mREIT ETF (BATS:REM) gained nearly 1% amid some chatter that sector investors might see a lighter tax bill on their dividends.
    • The conventional wisdom has been that mREITs stood to lose from the tax bill - as they mostly aren't subject to corporate taxes, the big corporate tax cut makes the C-Corp. structure relatively more attractive than a REIT.
    • Annaly Capital (NLY +1.5%), AGNC Investment (AGNC +1.5%), CYS Investment (CYS +1.5%), Invesco Mortgage (IVR +1.4%), Capstead Mortgage (CMO +1.4%), Armour Residential (ARR +0.9%), Anworth Mortgage (ANH +1%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 29 Comments
  • HRTX

    Heron launches stock offering; shares down 8% after hours

    • Heron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HRTX) slips 9% after hours on light volume in response to its planned public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • COUP

    Coupa Software -3.3% despite Q3 beats, upside guidance

    • Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) shares are down 3.3% aftermarket despite Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates and included upside guidance.
    • Q4 guidance: revenue, $48.3M to $48.8M (consensus: $47.72M); EPS, -$0.16 to -$0.14 (consensus: -$0.17). 
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $181.5M to $182M (consensus: $178.4M); EPS, -$0.39 to -$0.37 (consensus: -$0.48). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Coupa Software beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 6 Comments
  • GALT

    Galectin to present NASH data tomorrow; shares up 9% after hours

    • Galectin Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GALT) will announce results from the Phase 2 NASH-CX study tomorrow morning, December 5, at 8:30 am ET during its webcast. The trial is assessing lead candidate GR-MD-02 in 156 NASH patients. The primary endpoint is the reduction in hepatic venous pressure gradient versus placebo at year 1.
    • GR-MD-02 has already failed one Phase 2 NASH study (NASH-FX), reported several months ago, although the primary endpoint was different.
    • GR-MD-02 is a complex carbohydrate drug that targets galectin-3, a protein that plays a key role in the pathogenesis of fatty liver disease and fibrosis.
    • Shares have sold off almost 20% since November 20.
    • Shares are up 9% after hours on modest volume.
    • Previously: Galectin's GR-MD-02 flunks mid-stage NASH study; shares off 44% after hours (Sept. 27, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 23 Comments
  • COUP

    Coupa Software beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP): Q3 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $47.3M (+33.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.24M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • FOX

    Report: Disney in pole position for major Fox asset purchase; stocks rise

    • With a lot of moving parts (and moving stocks) around potential major asset sales at Fox (FOX +2.7%, FOXA +2.8%), it's still Disney (NYSE:DIS) that holds a preferred-buyer spot for Fox over several deep-pocketed rivals, sources tell Bloomberg.
    • That's because of a better strategic fit and fewer regulatory problems for Disney, vs. a cavalcade of other suitors linked to possible purchases: Comcast (CMCSA +4.9%), Verizon (VZ +0.9%), Sony (SNE +0.5%), and even Amazon.com (AMZN -2.5%).
    • Disney closed up 4.7% today after weekend reports noted renewed heat around a Disney-Fox deal, but the Murdoch family is also in discussions with Comcast. Links to purchase prospects of Verizon, Sony and Amazon are more loosely sourced for now.
    • A deal (for Fox's film and TV studio assets, as well as a stake in Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY), all worth some $50B) would mean Fox CEO James Murdoch could join Disney.
    • Sky shares gained 2.3% in U.S. trading today. A suitor buying Fox's 39% stake in Sky would trigger a mandatory offer for the rest of it under UK takeover rules.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 34 Comments
  • INNT

    Monster Digital terminates license deal, announces lawsuit dismissal (update)

    • Monster Digital (MSDI) terminates the license deal between its subsidiary SDJ Technologies and Monster, Inc.
    • Key portion of the press release: “The Company has been dissatisfied with the existing royalty rate under the License Agreement, especially in light of decreasing sales and demand for its action sports cameras and general softness in the overall market for action sports cameras and accessories. After much deliberation, management concluded that it could not continue to be party to the License Agreement under the existing terms.”
    • The license agreement will terminate within 90 days of Monster, Inc. receiving the notice.
    • Update: The company also announces the dismissal of a pending lawsuit challenging its upcoming merger with Innovate.
    • Monster Digital shares closed up 21%.
    • Previously: Monster Digital merger will close December 19 (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVID

    Avid announces ITV Studios Daytime selection

    • Avid (NASDAQ:AVID) announces that its Maestro next-generation graphics solutions were selected by ITV Studios Daytime to enhance live programming.
    • ITV will begin using Maestro for its flagship programming in April 2018. 
    • ITV creates over 1.5K hours of live broadcasts each year. 
    • Avid shares are up 5.7%.      
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • ALXN

    Ra Pharma's RA101495 pain is Alexion's gain, up 4%

    • Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +3.7%) is up on lower-than-normal volume in reaction to Ra Pharmaceuticals' (RARX -36.1%) rough day related to underwhelming mid-stage data on PNH candidate RA101495, a potential competitor to Alexion's Soliris (eculizumab).
    • Previously: Ra Pharma announces mid-stage data on PNH candidate RA101495, certain patients fail to tolerate switch from Soliris; shares down 31% (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • CPSH

    CPS Technologies announces Navy trials of armor solution

    • CPS Technologies (NASDAQ:CPSH) announces that an integrated armor solution incorporating the company’s HybridTech Armor is now undergoing trials with the U.S. Navy.
    • The armor solution was created with partner Kinetic Protection.
    • The Navy’s trails, which are testing environmental durability, will last into next year.
    • CPS shares are up 28%.  
    • Previously: CPS Technologies reports Q3 results (Nov. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    Microsoft extends its NFL deal for Surface tablets

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) extends its deal with the National Football League that makes the Surface the NFL’s official tablet  
    • The company signed a five-year deal with the NFL in 2013. The extension adds an additional year, which pushes the deal expiration to the end of the 2018-19 football season.
    • TechCrunch reports that Microsoft has spent over $400M on the Surface NFL deal to date. 
    • Microsoft shares are down 3.9%.  
    • Previously: Money continues to rotate out of tech (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 16 Comments
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks fade on dim view of Senate tax bill provisions

    • Solar industry stocks are slammed in today's trade as the tax bill passed by the U.S. Senate contains provisions that could harm wind and solar energy investment and deployment.
    • The bill's Base Erosion Anti-Abuse Tax, or BEAT, provision is intended to make it more difficult for businesses to avoid taxes but it also could make tax credits such as the renewable energy Production Tax Credit for wind power and the Investment Tax Credit for solar projects harder to monetize.
    • "If these provisions are retained, they will result in broad instability and uncertainty for businesses and investors across many sectors, including the clean energy sector," says a statement signed by six groups including the American Council on Renewable Energy.
    • "The BEAT program, as currently drafted, would have a devastating impact on renewable-energy investment and deployment," says another letter signed by four groups including the Solar Energy Industries Association.
    • FSLR -5.6%, SPWR -8.5%, CSIQ -9.2%, CAFD -4.6%, PEGI -3.6%, JKS -6.6%, DQ -14.6%.
    • ETFs: TAN KWT
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 182 Comments

  • KIM

    Retail landlords rally alongside their tenants

    • The SPDR S&P Retail ETF (XRT +2.5%) is having a big session following this weekend's passage of tax cuts. Among those on the move are mall stalwarts like Kohl's, J.C. Penney, Nordstrom, Diilard's, and Sears. Roughed-up apparel names like Chico's, J. Jill, Boot Barn, Buckle, DSW, and Express are on the move as well.
    • The landlords are moving higher even as the broader REIT sector (VNQ -0.4%), (IYR -0.6%) sells off: Kimco (KIM +3.8%), Taubman (TCO +2.1%), PREIT (PEI +2%), Macerich (MAC +1.7%), DDR (DDR +2.2%), Tanger Factory (SKT +1.7%), Kite Realty (KRG +3.2%), CBL (CBL +1.2%), Washington Prime (WPG +1.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 13 Comments
  • EROS

    Eros International -14.1% after $100M equity-linked financing

    • Eros International (NYSE:EROS) has slipped 14.1% and tagged session lows of $10.30 after word of an $100M equity-linked financing deal it's entered.
    • The filmmaker has definitive deals with an institutional investor regarding a direct offering of $122.5M in senior convertible notes due 202, and warrants to purchase 2M of its A-class shares.
    • Gross proceeds are $100M before expenses; net proceeds are to go to repay Eros' revolving credit and for general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • RCL

    Cruise line stocks weather tax legislation

    • Cruise line companies should fare just under the new tax reform legislation approved by the U.S. Senate, says Nomura Instinet analyst Harry Curtis.
    • "The sector should outperform since the Senate's tax bill does not include new taxes," Curtis observes. "Investors can focus on the industry’s strong top- and bottom-line growth rates," he adds.
    • Cruise line stocks Royal Caribbean (RCL +0.4%) and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NCLH +1.6%) have underperformed over the last few months, due in part to concerns over new travel taxes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale to use cash flow to cut debt, pay dividends, CEO Schvartsman says

    • Vale (VALE +4.3%) will use cash flow, which is expected to reach $14B-$15B this year, to cut debt and pay dividends, CEO Fabio Schvartsman says ahead of an investor day in Rio de Janiero.
    • The CEO says cash generation also could help the company’s debt rating, and notes that paying very high dividends is becoming company policy.
    • Schvartsman also says Vale will try to improve capital allocation, which should lead to stronger financial results over the long term.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 9 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon starts taking orders in Australia on Tuesday

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) will start taking orders in Australia on Tuesday.
    • The company will offer free shipping on orders over A$49 with delivery times ranging from three business days to the major cities and 10 business days to the more remote areas.
    • Amazon established its first large distribution warehouse near Melbourne.
    • Amazon hopes to launch Prime in Australia by the middle of next year.  
    • Amazon shares are down 1.3%.  
    • Previously: Wells Fargo raises Amazon price target to new Street high (Dec. 1)
    • Previously: VanEck Vectors Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (NYSEARCA:MOAT) November Summary (Dec. 4)
    • Previously: Money continues to rotate out of tech (Dec. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • NWBO

    Northwest Bio completes $12M financing; shares down 9%

    • Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO -8.8%) finalizes the sale of Series A convertible preferred stock and warrants raising $12M to fund operations.
    • Each Series A share, sold at $1.70, is convertible into 10 common shares at $0.17 each. The two-year warrants are exercisable at $0.22 per common share.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 23 Comments
  • DISCA

    Discovery takes majority control of Oprah Winfrey Network

    • Discovery Communications (DISCA +5.7%) is ramping up its investment in the Oprah Winfrey network, taking a majority stake in what had been a 50/50 joint venture.
    • Discovery is boosting its share by 24.5% for $70M, taking control of OWN from Winfrey herself, according to reports.
    • Winfrey will retain the title of CEO as well as the significant minority stake. Discovery will now claim the network's results in its financials.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 5 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Losers: SAEX -8%. TANH -7%. HOS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • LGF.A

    'Coco' leads again at mostly unchanged box office

    • With little new action happening at the box office over the weekend, Pixar's Coco (DIS +5.2%) was free to mint more gold, adding $26M in its second week at the top of an unchanged top six.
    • The film outgrossed Justice League (TWX +1.7%), which drew $16.6M in its third week, and Wonder (LGF.A -0.6%, LGF.B -0.4%), with $12.5M in its third week.
    • Coco crossed the $100M mark, hitting $108.7M in cumulative domestic grosses and just short of $280M on a worldwide basis. Meanwhile, Marvel's Thor: Ragnarok -- in fourth this week with $9.7M -- hit $291.4M domestically and $816.4M on a worldwide basis.
    • Over on the DC Universe side, Justice League has $197.3M in cumulative domestic (still a ways from surpassing Man of Steel's $291M there) and $567.4M worldwide.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • FBIO

    Mustang Bio closes license deal for CRISPR/Cas9-enhanced CAR-Ts; shares up 4%

    • Fortress Biotech's (FBIO -1.2%) Mustang Bio (MBIO +4.3%) inks a license agreement with Harvard's Office of Technology Development securing rights to technologies for off-the-shelf CAR-T therapies and CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing platforms that will be used, in conjunction with Mustang's CAR-T therapies, to treat blood cancers and solid tumors.
    • Separately, the company has also inked a research collaboration agreement with Boston's Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center aimed at developing CRISPR/Cas9-enhanced CAR-Ts.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 19 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer bull boosts price target; shares up more than 4%

    • The stock having rallied through his original $17 target, BTIG's Mark Palmer raises the outlook for Santander Consumer (NYSE:SC) to $21. That would be 9x expected 2019 EPS of $2.29.
    • Palmer's bull thesis is based on: 1) Credit performance should improve throughout 2018 thanks to the more stringent underwriting standards over the past two years, and 2) A significant increase in the chance parent Banco Santander (NYSE:SAN) uses ample excess capital at its U.S. subsidiary to purchase the rest of SC.
    • Shares are up 4.15% today to $18.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM

    | 1:00 PM
  • LOXO

    Loxo's larotrectinib shows significant treatment benefit in early-stage pediatric cancer study; shares ahead 2%

    • Updated data from a Phase 1 clinical trial, SCOUT, assessing Loxo Oncology's (LOXO +2.1%) larotrectinib in pediatric cancer patients showed a significant treatment effect. The results were presented today at the American Association for Cancer Research Special Conference on Pediatric Cancer Research in Atlanta, GA.
    • The overall response rate was 93% (n=14/15) in TRK fusion-evaluable patients, including 12 partial responders and two complete responders. The other patient had stable disease.
    • Larotrectinib (LOXO-101) inhibits a group of enzymes called tropomyosin receptor kinases (TRK), a group of proteins that plays a key role in cellular communications. Cancers hijack these communication pathways to send messages to cells to grow, change or survive. Those characterized by these alterations, termed NTRK fusions, are the therapeutic targets for the drug.
    • The company is co-developing and will co-commercialize larotrectinib with Bayer.
    • Previously: Loxo teams up with Bayer to develop TRK inhibitors; shares up 6% premarket (Nov. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • JD

    JD.com plans Europe, U.S. expansion for 2018

    • JD.com (NASDAQ:JD) has its eyes on becoming a well-recognized international player, and starting soon, according to its CEO.
    • Speaking at the World Internet Conference in China, CEO Liu Qiangdong says the company is looking at a rollout in Europe and the U.S. as soon as next year.
    • And in 10-20 years, the company will be well recognized by customers worldwide, he says.
    • The company aspires to be the top e-commerce player in Southeast Asia, a head challenge against the likes of Alibaba (BABA -1.6%), China's sales leader.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 45 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PXS +118%. ASTC +59%. BGC +35%. DPW +27%. CPSH +20%. APRN +20%. EXAC +19%. UUUU +17%. OHRP +16%. UEC +15%.
    • Losers: RARX -37%. DQ -16%. TPIC -12%. SALM -12%. SGRP -11%. EFOI -9%. KTCC -10%. ZGNX -10%. CSIQ -10%. VOXX -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • CVS

    CVS to finance Aetna deal with $65.8B in new debt and equity; shares down 5%

    • CVS Health (CVS -5.4%) slumps on almost triple normal volume in apparent response to its financing approach for its $69B takeover of health insurer Aetna (AET -0.4%).
    • It plans to issue $44.8B in new debt and $21B in new equity (CVS Investor Presentation, Slide #21) in addition to using $4.1B of cash on hand.
    • In a note, Piper Jaffray's Sarah James says ideally AET shareholders would have received more cash. She values Aetna at $218 (above the $207 purchase price) and sees a 10% long-term growth rate.
    • JPMorgan's Gary Taylor: $207/share may reflect a view that tax reform EPS benefits will be immediately competed away in the form of lower premiums. Strategic fit "modest" but rationale consistent with recent industry trends.
    • Leerink's Ana Gupte: The companies are both playing defense against a potential entry by Amazon, captive PBMs, regulatory scrutiny of PBM and retail pharmacy margins. Skeptical of $750M in synergies. Transaction appears neutral in the second year post close. Humana (HUM +0.5%) - Cigna (CI -1.5%) marriage may be the next big deal.
    • Jefferies' Brian Tanquilut: Concerns with transformation of CVS's 9,000+ store footprint and and integration of Aetna.
    • Cowen's Charles Rhyee: Expects regulatory OK of the deal. Merger mimics current structure of UnitedHealth Group (UNH -1%) and Optum.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 22 Comments
  • DQ

    Daqo starts week on the back foot

    • Bad timing? Roth Capital has raised its price target on Daqo New Energy (NYSE:DQ) to $65 from $50, while reiterating a Buy rating on shares.
    • Despite the move, the stock has started the week deep in the red, down over 15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • UCTT

    Stifel upgrades Ultra Clean Holdings

    • Stifel upgrades Ultra Clean Holdings (NASDAQ:UCTT) from Hold to Buy with a $17 price target after the recent pulback.
    • Firm believes Ultra Clean is well positioned to benefit from another strong year in wafer fan equipment and display spending.
    • Stifel says Ultra Clean has attractive multiples putting it in-line with competitor Ichor Holdings (NASDAQ:ICHR). 
    • Ultra Clean shares are up 5.9%. 
    • Ichor shares are down 7.7%.   
    • Previously: Ultra Clean Holdings -9% after Q3 EPS miss, upside guidance (Oct. 26)

  • CRNT

    Ceragon Networks receives $66M in orders

    • Ceragon Networks (NASDAQ:CRNT) announces receiving $66M n orders for its IP-20 Platform.
    • The orders came from a tier 1 operator located in India.
    • Total orders for products and services from tier 1 operators in India now totals over $100M during 2H17.
    • Order shipments will begin in December and Ceragon expects to recognize $10M in Q4 with the balance coming in 1H18.
    • Ceragon shares are up 11.6%.   
    • Previously: Ceragon Networks down after Q3 revenue miss, "lumpiness" in India business (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia -3.8% as Exane cuts to Underperform

    • Nokia (NYSE:NOK) is off 3.8% in U.S. trading after a downgrade at Exane BNP Paribas, to Underperform from Neutral.
    • The broker is reiterating an Outperform on Ericsson (ERIC -0.3%), and says Ericsson may gain market share at Nokia's expense with a new focus on mobile equipment R&D, vs. a riskier outlook in that area at Nokia vs. market expectations.
    • Shares in Nokia are down 21% since a downbeat earnings report that showed a glum outlook for its key Networking business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 29 Comments
  • IRWD

    Ironwood's IW-1973 shows treatment effect in mid-stage studies, upper GI hemorrhage case pressures shares, down 6%

    • Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -5.7%) is down in apparent reaction to the one case of upper gastrointestinal (GI) hemorrhage in a clinical trial patient treated with IW-1973. All other adverse events were considered mild.
    • Investors appear be more concerned with the potential side effect rather than the positive topline results from studies in patients with type 2 diabetes and hypertension.
    • The treatment groups in both studies experienced reductions in blood pressure and improvements in metabolic parameters like fasting plasma glucose and cholesterol levels.
    • The company is currently investigating IW-1973 for the treatment of diabetic nephropathy and heart failure with preserved ejection fraction. Two Phase 2 dose-ranging studies were recently launched.
    • IM-1973 stimulates soluble guanylate cyclase, the only known receptor for nitric oxide, a naturally produced gas in the body that expands blood vessels.

  • RARE

    Ultragenyx Pharma's burosumab shows sustained treatment effect in late-stage XLH study; shares up 1%

    • Ultragenyx Pharmaceutical (RARE +0.8%) and development partner Kyowa Kirin International announce positive long-term data from a Phase 3 clinical trial assessing burosumab (KRN23) in adults with X-linked hypophosphatemia (XLH), an inherited form of rickets (vitamin D deficiency) in which sufferers do not benefit from ingesting vitamin D.
    • Patients receiving burosumab for 48 weeks experienced sustained normal serum phosphorus levels and improvement in XLH-related symptoms of stiffness, physical function and pain. Patients who crossed over from placebo to burosumab at week 24 experienced the same benefits.
    • The companies intend to share the data with global regulatory authorities.
    • Burosumab is a recombinant fully human monoclonal IgG1 antibody that binds to FGF23, a hormone that reduces serum phosphorus and active vitamin D by regulating phosphate excretion and active vitamin D production by the kidney.
    • Ultragenyx's U.S. marketing application is currently under FDA review with an action date of April 17, 2018.
    • Previously: No Ad Com review planned for Ultragenyx BLA for burosumab for XLH, action data April 2018; shares up 3% (Nov. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment

  • RARX

    Ra Pharma announces mid-stage data on PNH candidate RA101495, certain patients fail to tolerate switch from Soliris; shares down 31%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Ra Pharmaceuticals (RARX -31.3%) slumps on almost a 5x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of less than 600K shares, in reaction to interim data from a 29-subject Phase 2 clinical trial assessing RA101495 SC in patients with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH).
    • In the eculizumab (Alexion Pharmaceuticals' Soliris)-naive cohort (n=10), patients receiving RA101495 SC achieved a statistically significant reduction in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) levels from baseline to weeks 6-12 (p=0.002). 50% of transfusion-dependent patients at entry remained so after treatment with RA101495 SC (which means half remained transfusion-dependent despite treatment).
    • In the cohort that switched from Soliris to RA101495 SC, the LDH response was bimodal (two peaks). In transfusion-independent patients (n=5), LDH levels were stable with no episodes of breakthrough hemolysis (simultaneous elevations of LDH and a liver enzyme called AST).
    • In transfusion-dependent patients (n=11), breakthrough hemolysis occurred in 64% (n=7/11) of those switching to RA101495 SC, all of which stabilized after switching back to Soliris.
    • In the cohort that responded inadequately to Soliris (n=3), one patient has demonstrated improvement in side effects related to eculizumab intolerance.
    • The value proposition of RA101495 SC, a complement component 5 inhibitor, is self-administered subcutaneous injection. Soliris is a monoclonal antibody administered via IV infusion over a period of 35 minutes in adult patients.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 4 Comments

    • Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +2.8%) is ordered by a U.S. federal judge to coordinate with tribes to create an oil spill response plan for the Dakota Access Pipeline by April 1.
    • The judge also wants ETP to receive feedback from tribes and get an independent auditor to review easement conditions and to submit bi-monthly reports on safety conditions at the Lake Oahe pipeline crossing, the focus of anti-pipeline protests last year.

    • Apple’s (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone X accounts for over 2% of the iPhone active installed base, according to IHS Markit data.

  • ZYNE

    Zynerba's ZYN002 shows treatment effect in epilepsy studies; shares ahead 10% premarket

    • Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) is up 10% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive data on lead candidate ZYN002 (cannabidiol [CBD] gel) in epilepsy patients.
    • Results from the Phase 2 STAR 1 trial and the ongoing 18-month open-label extension study, STAR 2, showed reductions in focal seizures from baseline. Specifically, patients who received topical gel ZYN002 for a total of nine months (three in STAR 1 at 195 mg and six in STAR 2 at 390 mg) experienced a median reduction in seizures of 65%. Patients who received 390 mg for the entire nine months experienced a 48% median reduction in seizures.
    • In August, the company reported that STAR 1 failed to demonstrate a treatment effect compared to placebo due to an unexpectedly high placebo effect (50% reduction in focal seizures in the control group).
    • On the safety front, ZYN002 was very well tolerated throughout the treatment period.
    • The design of a new study should be clarified next quarter and launched later in 2018.
    • Previously: Zynerba's lead candidate ZYN002 flunks mid-stage study in osteoarthritis-associated knee pain; shares down 29% premarket (Aug. 14)
